founder.name: Michael Yan
founder.title: Chief Executive Officer
founder.description: Michael is a second-year undergraduate at the University of California, Berkeley studying Molecular and Cellular Biology with a minor in Public Policy. With professional interests in politics and health economics, he aims to pursue a career in health policy and clinical research as a physician-economist. As the CEO of Think Neuro, he is eager to democratize health information at the grassroots level, drive structural change within healthcare and insurance policy, and forge intergenerational communities by connecting with populations often overlooked in the education space, particularly children of uninsured, low-income, and limited-English proficiency (LEP) households. Outside of academics, Michael enjoys golfing on weekday mornings and sing-songwriting as a true tenor.

founder.name: Lalita Sabat
founder.title: Chief Operating Officer
founder.description: Lalita is a third year undergraduate student at Virginia Commonwealth University/ VCU School of Medicine majoring in Biology with a minor in Chemistry. She is a student in the BS/MD program aiming to become a physician. Outside of academics, Lalita is a dancer on her college Bollywood Fusion Dance Team. She has performed at various regional competitions in Alabama and North Carolina winning second place at both. She is also a research assistant in the Department of Biology - Neurobiology. She has presented abstracts at the Virginia Collegiate Honors Council (VCHC) and the Central Virginia Society of Neuroscience. In addition, she has a wide array of expertise in a variety of healthcare environments. With a passion for volunteering in her community, she uses her free time to give back to the communities that have bolstered her growth. This includes volunteering at the soup kitchen at her University and as a tutor at her University’s Campus Learning Center.

founder.name: Briana Lay
founder.title: Board President
founder.description: Briana is a third-year undergraduate student at UCLA majoring in Human Biology and Society, an interdisciplinary major that intersects the social sciences and life sciences. She is passionate about finding ways on how environmental health overlaps with personal health and discovering solutions for its adverse effects. She currently serves as a Khmer Outreach, Retention, and Education Director where she manages outreach and mentorship efforts at Long Beach Unified School District. She is also a research assistant for a cognition lab, finance director at Bruins Public Health, department volunteer at UCLA Health, and an Ambassador.

board.name: Jasmine Tai
board.title: Chief of Staff
board.description: Jasmine is an undergraduate student at the University of California, Berkeley double majoring in Molecular Cell Biology and Psychology. She is passionate about healthcare and hopes to go into the biotechnology or pharmaceutical industry. Jasmine is currently a research assistant at University of California, San Francisco and has been a health worker for University Health Services in the past. She is also a student mentor for elementary students through the Sage Mentorship program. Outside of academics, Jasmine enjoys golfing and exploring the Bay.

board.name: Matthew Fok
board.title: Chief of Outreach
board.description: Matthew is a second-year undergraduate student at UCI majoring in biology. He is interested in life sciences and hopes to explore more on biotech and medical research. He is currently a clinical researcher at the UCI medical center in Orange where he conducts patient chart reviews and monitors patients in a neuro-ICU using spectroscopy devices to measure tissue oxygenation activity. He hopes to one day pursue a career in medicine. In his free time, Matthew enjoys swimming and going out to eat with friends.

board.name: Nicole Nakama
board.title: Chief of Education
board.description: Nicole is a second-year undergraduate student studying Neuroscience at UCLA. She is passionate about neuropsychology, the public policy surrounding various health disparities seen across the U.S.,  and developing solutions as such which has been her main drive for pursuing a career in medicine and public health. She is currently working under the Clinical and Translational Center at UCLA with other physicians and administration aiding in various projects and tasks geared towards the division and UCLA Health as a whole, a virtual tutor to a few elementary-aged students in various school districts across Southern California, and a medical scribe down in Long Beach, CA. Outside of school, Nicole also enjoys weightlifting, being outdoors, reading, journaling, and traveling.

board.name: Isabela Gonzalez
board.title: Chief of Legal Affairs
board.description: Isabela is a second-year undergraduate student studying Psychology and Legal Studies at the University of California Berkeley. She is interested in human interaction and behavior as well as the roles of the human mind within the branches of our law. She aspires to one day become an Immigration Lawyer helping families gain a pathway to citizenship. Isabela joined Think Neuro because she wants to help underserved communities. In her free time, Isabela loves binging Desperate Housewives, writing poetry, and drawing.

board.name: Tiffany Cheng
board.title: Chief of Design
board.description: Tiffany is a second year undergraduate at the University of California Berkeley studying Dance and Performance Studies and Media Studies with a concentration in digital media. She aspires to connect with others through the arts in all forms. She has worked as a freelance graphic designer throughout all of high school and has continued her passion for design in college. She is currently a graphic designer for Innovative Design, the largest creative agency on the UC Berkeley campus. In her free time, Tiffany enjoys dancing, drawing, and exploring new places.

board.name: Cody Tran
board.title: Chief of Data
board.description: Cody is a current second year undergraduate at UC Berkeley majoring in Chemical Biology and minoring in Nutritional Sciences. In the future, Cody strives to involve himself within pharmaceutical research and medicinal chemistry. Currently, he has involved himself within the Albrecht Lab in the Department of Pharmaceutical Sciences at UC Irvine where he studies lysosomal activity and its corresponding effects with different drugs through utilizing western blotting, gel electrophoresis, and other methods. Additionally, he is currently working in the Moore Lab in the Department of Nutritional Sciences and Toxicology at UC Berkeley, focusing on FACT-protein mediated DNA transcription. Outside of academics, Cody enjoys working out, doing karaoke with friends, and shoutcasting for UC Berkeley’s competitive esports club.

board.name: Fengyi Huang
board.title: Chief of Finance
board.description: Fengyi is a second year undergraduate at the University of California, Berkeley, studying Computer Science and Applied Mathematics. He is also the project coordinator under Professor David Levine for ChatCHW, an AI chatbot intended to help community health workers in less fortunate countries. While not directly related to Neuroscience, Fengyi is very interested in the field and is currently learning more about it. Fengyi plans on attending graduate school for a Master’s in Computer Science as well as working on a business, and hopes to pursue a MBA as well in the future. He hopes that in the future, he is able to use his knowledge of Computer Science and Business to make a positive impact on the world. Outside of school, Fengyi loves all forms of outdoor activities, socializing with people, and working on personal projects.

board.name: Asli Aktepe
board.title: Chief of Communications
board.description: Asli is a fourth year undergraduate student at UC Berkeley studying Molecular and Cell Biology with an emphasis in Neurobiology. She is extremely passionate about the convergence of immunology and neurobiology and aspires to pursue a PhD degree and a research career that allows her to further explore these fields. Asli served as a research assistant at Rapid Revivers/Infectious Diseases, where she gained extensive knowledge in experimental processes, recent therapeutic advancements in the realm of infectious diseases, and the progression of diseases. This position also fostered her interest in public health and advocacy. Outside of her academic pursuits, Asli enjoys cooking, quality time with loved ones, and embarking on adventures to new places.

board.name: Jude Alexis
board.title: Chief of Technology
board.description: Jude is a first-year undergraduate at Berkeley studying Molecular and Cellular Biology with pre-med ambitions. With professional clinical experience, heavy technical exposure to CS, and a passion for ensuring the human good, Jude aims to be on the bleeding edge of the increasing digitization of medicine. In his free time he enjoys reading and playing chess.

board.name: Jimin Yoo
board.title: Chief of Public Relations
board.description: Jimin Yoo is a second year undergraduate student at UC Berkeley studying Molecular Cell Biology and hoping to pursue a career in the field of medicine. She is passionate about cancer research as well as various health disparities present in the United States. Currently, she works at the Chen Lab at the UC Berkeley School of Optometry where she assists in mice experiments and image analysis to treat lymphatic diseases. She also provides mentoring for elementary students under the SAGE mentoring program as an executive board member. In her free time, Jimin loves meeting new people, trying new restaurants, singing, and traveling.

board.name: Fatima Khan Lookmanji
board.title: Chief of Research
board.description: Fatima is an enthusiastic senior biology student and science devotee pursuing an Honours Bachelor of Sciences in Life Sciences at the University of Ontario Institute of Technology. As President of multiple clubs and extracurriculars, she actively engages in these roles, alongside her involvement in extensive volunteering across charitable organizations in Canada. Fatima aspires to continue her altruistic journey through continuous academic development and new experiences that will further allow her to practice her passion of providing aid to vulnerable communities.

board.name: Dhruva Bhat
board.title: Chief of Conferences
board.description: Dhruva Bhat is a junior at Foothill High School, with a passion for neuroscience and community service. He hopes to pursue a career within the field of medicine and is currently president of the Neuroscience club at his school. His passion for making an impact within his community has led him to participate in various volunteering opportunities, including at Kaiser Permanente and the American Cancer Society. Along with this, he has a passion for research and innovation and you can frequently find him building various contraptions.

board.name: Vivian Tran
board.title: Chief of Marketing
board.description: Vivian Tran is a graduate student pursuing her Master of Public Health in Health Behaviors at UC San Diego. She is a recent Spring 2023 graduate from UC Berkeley double majoring in Molecular & Cell Biology and Integrative Human Biology and minoring in Global Public Health. She currently works with the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) within the Substance and Addiction Prevention Branch (SAPB) as a Graduate Researcher to improve public health responses towards opioid misuse. She also is conducting research with the Moores Cancer Center for her thesis and has had a variety of research experience in fields of biochemistry, physics, and public health during her time at UC Berkeley. Beyond her academic pursuits, Vivian is a Certified Clinical Medical Assistant (CCMA) at a local clinic, and aspires to go into the medical field. She's also a passionate food enthusiast, exploring culinary scenes wherever she goes.

board.name: Shree Parekh
board.title: Chief of Operations
board.description: Shree is a first year undergraduate student at UC Berkeley majoring in Molecular Cell Biology with an emphasis in Neurobiology, along with intended major in Psychology. She has an ongoing passion for the medical field within Neurology and is interested in pursuing pediatrics, putting higher concentration on mental health. Since high school, she has been advocating for vape prevention and mental health awareness to youth elementary schools by hosting presentations. Shree currently does research in a cognitive neuroscience lab called D’Esposito Lab at UC Berkeley. In the fall, Shree will start volunteering at UCSF, with hopes to work in the neonatal department! Away from academics, Shree loves to dance, night drives, and quality time with her little siblings!

board.name: Reymon Moe
board.title: Chief of Medicine
board.description: Reymon is a third year undergraduate at UC Berkeley. Specializing in a double major in Molecular Cell Biology (Immunology) and Public Health, Reymon exhibits an unwavering passion for deepening their knowledge and understanding of the complexities of the human body and its interaction with the environment. Reymon has demonstrated a keen interest in the practical application of his studies, as evident through his involvement in internships at both UCLA and UCSF. At both locations Reymon played an integral role in kidney clinical trials, gaining invaluable experience and insights into medical research methods and patient care. Currently, Reymon is diving deeper into the world of molecular biology through his position in the Bustamante Lab at Berkeley.

chair.name: Avinna Jain
chair.title: Professional Development Chair
chair.description: Avinna is a junior studying Molecular and Cell Biology with a concentration in Neurobiology at University of California, Berkeley. She is also the Academic chair in the campus organization Gender Equity in Math, which promotes underrepresented groups to find a place in math and foster their academic success. Avinna plans to go to medical school to obtain an M.D. She enjoys reading, biking, and doing puzzles in her free time.

chair.name: Anirudh Yarlagadda
chair.title: Community Service Chair
chair.description: Anirudh is a second year undergraduate at the University of California, Berkeley, studying Business Administration and Molecular and Cell Biology and concentrating in Neurobiology. He is passionate about combining medicine with business and finding innovative ways to make medicine more accessible to everyone. Anirudh works as a clinical and administrative assistant at Six Corners Same Day Surgeries in Chicago, Illinois. Additionally, he is an undergraduate researcher at the Bhattacharya Lab at the University of California, San Francisco where he studies the treatment of pulmonary diseases with the use of macrophages. Outside of academics, Anirudh is in the California Marching Band where he plays both brass and percussion instruments. In his free time, Anirudh enjoys playing and watching sports, mainly football, volleyball, and cricket.

chair.name: Prongha Talukder
chair.title: Curriculum Chair
chair.description: Prongha is a rising second year student at the University of California, Berkeley, studying Molecular and Cellular Biology, with a concentration in Neurobiology. He is passionate about public health and mental health research and has done work with research groups focusing on the spread of Covid and mental health legislation in India. He is also passionate about public service and is part of the Berkeley Project and Berkeley Blood Pressure Project where he serves the greater Berkeley community. He plans to pursue an M.D after his degree. He loves badminton, biking, the outdoors, and hanging out with friends.

chair.name: Veronica Uy
chair.title: Philanthropy Chair
chair.description: Veronica is a rising third year at University of California, berkeley majoring in Molecular and Cell Biology. She is passionate about medicine and the humanities (such as art, history, literature, and language). She has done previous work as the head of fundraising for multiple organizations like activist group Generation Up and has volunteered for organizations like the Red Cross. Veronica is planning to pursue a career in medicine while practicing her other passions such as drawing, writing, and travel in the meantime.

chair.name: Amara Ajon
chair.title: Ambassador Chair
chair.description: Amara is a rising third year at UCLA majoring in psychobiology. She is extremely passionate about mental health and cognition, and currently serves as a Research Assistant for the UCLA Stress Lab — where she is a part of the consent team for an ongoing clinical research study about how childhood ACEs affect stress resilience. Besides her involvement in Think Neuro, she also volunteers at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, works as a certified medical assistant, and holds leadership positions in other pre-medical clubs on campus. In the future, she plans to pursue a career in medicine but for now she spends her free time reading, hiking, driving, and reviewing restaurants as part of the Yelp Elite.

chair.name: Sahaj Kaur
chair.title: Marketing Chair
chair.description: Sahaj is a first year student studying molecular and cell biology at Cal State University Fullerton. She is passionate about health care and hopes to go into advanced medicine research revolving around pharmacology. She has done previous work such as volunteering in health fairs for the service of minority groups and is currently working on getting licensed to work in pharmacy related settings. In her free time she loves to read, do oil paintings, and go on hiking trails.
